page.title: 02WADDINGTON-HOMES AND JOBS
page.content: The population of Waddington is about 5000. Statistics, though, are confused by the presence of R.A.F. Waddington between the main Lincoln to Sleaford and Grantham roads on the heath sloping eastward from the ridge. The two parts of Waddington are linked by the long and often steep Station Road which has a sprinkling of good-sized brick-built homes. 70% of houses are privately owned and less than 10% are council houses. The area is surrounded by farmland, chiefly arable, but there are only two or three farms nearby and no-one considers Waddington to be a farming community. There is a small industrial estate in upper Waddington and many local people are employed at the R.A.F. camp but most people work outside the village, mainly in Lincoln.
